wiki.content: The Shadow Days Songfacts says that American pianist and keyboardist Chuck Leavell, formerly of the Allman Brothers Band, plays on this track. He also worked with The Rolling Stones throughout the '80s. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: The Shadow Days Songfacts says that American pianist and keyboardist Chuck Leavell, formerly of the Allman Brothers Band, plays on this track. He also worked with The Rolling Stones throughout the '80s.

track.name: Shadow Days
comments: very beatles esque tone on the solo
Nice song.... Nice voice....
yes, they are over if you want it. One of the best albums in recent years.
sounded like Mainstreet by Bob Seger at first listen
스웨덴 자연과 조화를 이루며 살고있다. 그래서 그는 작은 핵 발전소를 많이 만듭니다. 겨울에는 곰처럼 사냥이나 가구점으로 이동합니다. 그럼 그 사람은 술 많이와의 슬픔을 빠져 죽었. 다시 응원하려면 다음 그는 그 돈을 계산하고, 그의 머리 금발을 염색. 요약 : 약간 정신 분열증이다.
Música da minha vida. Perfeita demais. #MeIdentifico.
Of the entire album, this not one I would have put in my top 5. This song is good, but the rest of the album is amazing.
This works good at the highway!
basically, "I've been a tiny bit of an ass, but I'm a nice guy, so let's pretend nothing happened, okay?" so self-pitying... elsewhere the album is much better though
must-hear-song in Born & Raised. So country, but deep feelings :D
my story
Kinda sounds like Tracing, the B-side on Bigger Than My Body.
Wow, the lyrics to this song are so personal and beautiful. I dig this.
For John, it's a grower but it's suprisingly really good.
As a lead single, this is so much better than "Who Says." [02]
I miss you <3
SHADOW DAYS <3
BEAUTIFUL VIDEO *-*
